qas.question: To what age did Passos Coelho increase the retirement age?
To what did Passos Coelho announce cuts to?

answers.text: pensions, unemployment benefits, health, education and science expenses

qas.question: Which obligatory class was abolished from Basic Education?
What did the instituting of these policies lead to?

answers.text: social unrest and to confrontations between several institutions

context: Passos Coelho also announced that the retirement age will be increased from 65 to <a0_0>66<a0_0/>, announced cuts in the <a1_0>pensions, unemployment benefits, health, education and science expenses<a1_0/>, abolished the <a2_0>English<a2_0/> obligatory classes in Basic Education, but kept the pensions of the judges, diplomats untouched and didn't raise the retirement age of the military and police forces. He has, however, cut meaningfully the politicians salaries. These policies have led to <a3_0>social unrest and to confrontations between several institutions<a3_0/>, namely between the Government and the Constitutional Court. Several individualities belonging to the parties that support the government have also raised their voices against the policies that have been taken in order to try to solve the financial crisis.
